title: Fix path overlap judgement while doing logical plan for schema fetch
body:
## Description

### Problem
When execute "select s1 from root.**", there's no result returned while there do exists timeseries "root.sg.d.s1".

### Cause
When doing logical plan for schema fetch, the pattern tree should be split by storage group. The path pattern of each sub tree should overlap with the path pattern starting with the sg path and ending with **, rather than match or be matched.

### Solution
Implement the overlap judgement algorithm and apply it in the logical plan stage.

### Result screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38524330/168045016-2b19e6ed-1243-40fb-97b7-049f136393b2.png)

title: [IOTDB-3161] Add <API Comparison> under the <API> of iotdb official website.
Modify aligned timeseries doc
body:
## Description

### Motivation
The description of aligned timeseries in Data-model doc is confusing. The usage of the adj ```aligned``` mix the scenario feature and the data model concept and tech in the system.

### Modification
Avoid using the adj ```aligned``` to describe the scenario feature. Now it is only used in the description of the data model concept and tech in the system.

title: [IOTDB-3155] Optimize the schedule of MPP framework
body:
## Description
1. Use separate threadPool for write operation to avoid the dead-lock issue when dispatching WRITE FragmentInstance
2. Optimize the unnecessary RPC when dispatch FragmentInstance to local node. When the fragment instance is executed in local node, skip the RPC layer and put it into the Consensus layer directly.

## Other issues
Fix three bugs which block the local dispatch process. Before this change, some logic was put in the `serialize()` method. If the `serialize()` method is not invoked, the necessary code logic is lost and the bug appears.

title: [IOTDB-3053] Copyset algorithm when create timeseries
body:
Changes:

- Use Copyset algorithm for **the first Region allocation** of each StorageGroup. You can see this doc: [RegionGroup allocation](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnHuDkDD6RiwLjaej3hkA9Vb) for more details.
- Modify the behaviors of some RPC interfaces, including **setStorageGroup**, **getOrCreateSchemaPartition** and **getOrCreateDataPartition** to adapt to Copyset algorithm. You can see this doc: [ConfigNode for DataNode RPC interfaces](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnCp13O7QDU7O6GMvagUwEDc#4ZxOG4)
- Build basic **LoadBalance framework** for future development.

Incidentally framework adjust:

- Delete the **data_dirs** parameter.
- More secure restart parameter checking process. See ConfigNodeStartupCheck.java
- Allows to change the folder locations on restart. See ConfigNodeStartupCheck.java

title: [IOTDB-3071] change siganature of getDeviceIdString in Path
Fix multi level sg creation bug
body:
## Description


### Cause
The storage group info management of dataNode went wrong when createSchemaRegion. The localStorageGroupSchemaManager go through the auto create sg logic with normal path rather than specified storage group path. It means when the target storage group path is root.a.sg, the sg created by ensureStorageGroup method is root.a since the default sg level is 1.

### Solution
rewrite the logic of localStorageGroupSchemaManager.ensureStorageGroup
rename it to ensureStorageGroupByStorageGroupPath


### Result screenshot

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38524330/167544543-59400801-d200-4f72-b67b-9571fd1464af.png)

body: See [IOTDB-3135](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3135).

title: [IOTDB-3073][IOTDB-3095] Unescape identifier and Use antlr to parse PartialPath/Path
body:
## Description
In this PR, I use antlr to split path(String type) in the construction methods of PartialPath and Path. Before this PR, path split was done through a written split function which may lead to unexpected errors in some corner cases. After merging this PR, path is correct only if you can write it in a SQL statement, too. For example, new PartialPath("root.sg.select") will throw exception now because "select" is a key word and in SQL statement, it should be written as root.sg.\`select\`. Thus, new PartialPath("root.sg.\`select\`") is the correct form. Before this PR, in some occasion, PartialPath(String path) was called, but it didn't matter whether the path were split correctly, for we only care about the fullPath of PartialPath. In this PR, I fix problems related to this cause. Below are the cases:
1. In GroupByLevelDataSet, call PartialPath(String path, boolean needSplit) explicitly.
2. Modified  fillTargetPathTemplate in CountinousQueryTask.
3. Modified SHA256DeviceID in idtable package.

title: [IOTDB-3117][snapshot] add authInfo snapshot.
body:
implement snapshot of authInfo.
When take snapshot, authInfo will copy both user folder and role folder into snapshot.
When load snapshot, authInfo will copy user folder and role folder from snapshot into system folder.

title: [IOTDB-3127] Fix tree traverse algorithm
body:
## Description

### 1. Move tree algorithm framework to node commons

### 2. Add status record to avoid repeating check
In ```findLastMatch``` procedure, the node matching will be repeated, implemented as nested loop. Add status record to reduce repeating check.


### 3. Refactor the sub tree visit condition to fix getMatchedDevice bug
#### 3.1 Cause
Before consuming the device node, the algorithm pushed the children into visitStack and the device node to ancestorStack. This will bring repeating device node name when constructing the result.

#### 3.2. Solution
Add ```shouldVisitSubtree``` variable to help control the process. When meeting a matched device node, save its matching info and context before return. After consuming the device node, process its subtree based on the saved info and context.

title: Bump protobuf-java from 3.0.0-beta-1 to 3.16.1 in /hive-connector
body:
Bumps [protobuf-java](https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf) from 3.0.0-beta-1 to 3.16.1.
Release notes

Sourced from protobuf-java's releases.

Protocol Buffers v3.16.1

Java

  • Improve performance characteristics of UnknownFieldSet parsing (#9371)

Protocol Buffers v3.16.0

C++

  • Fix compiler warnings issue found in conformance_test_runner #8189 (#8190)
  • Fix MinGW-w64 build issues. (#8286)
  • [Protoc] C++ Resolved an issue where NO_DESTROY and CONSTINIT are in incorrect order (#8296)
  • Fix PROTOBUF_CONSTINIT macro redefinition (#8323)
  • Delete StringPiecePod (#8353)
  • Fix gcc error: comparison of unsigned expression in '>= 0' is always (#8309)
  • Fix cmake install on iOS (#8301)
  • Create a CMake option to control whether or not RTTI is enabled (#8347)
  • Fix endian.h location on FreeBSD (#8351)
  • Refactor util::Status (#8354)
  • Make util::Status more similar to absl::Status (#8405)
  • Fix -Wsuggest-destructor-override for generated C++ proto classes. (#8408)
  • Refactor StatusOr and StringPiece (#8406)
  • Refactor uint128 (#8416)
  • The ::pb namespace is no longer exposed due to conflicts.
  • Allow MessageDifferencer::TreatAsSet() (and friends) to override previous calls instead of crashing.
  • Reduce the size of generated proto headers for protos with string or bytes fields.
  • Move arena() operation on uncommon path to out-of-line routine
  • For iterator-pair function parameter types, take both iterators by value.
  • Code-space savings and perhaps some modest performance improvements in RepeatedPtrField.
  • Eliminate nullptr check from every tag parse.
  • Remove unused _$name$cached_byte_size fields.
  • Serialize extension ranges together when not broken by a proto field in the middle.
  • Do out-of-line allocation and deallocation of string object in ArenaString.
  • Streamline ParseContext::ParseMessage to avoid code bloat and improve performance.
  • New member functions RepeatedField::Assign, RepeatedPtrField::{Add, Assign}.
  • Fix undefined behavior warning due to innocuous uninitialization of value on an error path.
  • Avoid expensive inlined code space for encoding message length for messages

    = 128 bytes and instead do a procedure call to a shared out-of-line routine.

  • util::DefaultFieldComparator will be final in a future version of protobuf. Subclasses should inherit from SimpleFieldComparator instead.

C#

  • Add .NET 5 target and improve WriteString performance with SIMD (#8147)

Java

  • deps: update JUnit and Truth (#8319)
  • Detect invalid overflow of byteLimit and return InvalidProtocolBufferException as documented.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 791a435 Update protobuf version
  • e891872 Update CHANGES.txt for 3.16.1 release
  • f554cca Improve performance of parsing unknown fields in Java (#9371)
  • 2dc747c Update PHP release notes and update version to 3.16.0 (#8573)
  • debc03d Update protobuf version to 3.16.0-rc2 (#8556)
  • 17b0fb9 Make update_version.py compatible with Python 3 (#8555)
  • 4aa425c Cherry-pick #8356 into 3.16.x (#8518)
  • e8b78f8 Fixed memory leak of Ruby arena objects. (#8465)
  • 7689f00 Update protobuf version (#8448)
  • 6099c65 Updated CHANGES.txt for 3.16.0 (#8456)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.google.protobuf:protobuf-java&package-manager=maven&previous-version=3.0.0-beta-1&new-version=3.16.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/network/alerts).

body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3122
**1 bug + 1 enhance**

1) **Bug**: In windows, stop-server.bat can not close server. this bug should have existed since 2021.12.

[IOTDB-1239]Incorrect datetime value can be inserted into iotdb successfully
body:
## Description

Resubmit PR 
- #3000

fix [IOTDB-1239](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1239)
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1239
support big datetime parse and query

```
IoTDB> SET STORAGE GROUP TO root.sg
Msg: The statement is executed successfully.
IoTDB> CREATE TIMESERIES root.sg.d1.s2 WITH DATATYPE=DOUBLE, ENCODING=PLAIN
IoTDB> insert into root.sg.d1(time,s2 ) values (1574179200000000,8.76);
Msg: The statement is executed successfully.
IoTDB> select * from root.sg.d1;
+-------------------------------+-------------+
|                           Time|root.sg.d1.s2|
+-------------------------------+-------------+
|+51853-10-03T00:00:00.000+08:00|         8.76|
+-------------------------------+-------------+
Total line number = 1
It costs 0.328s
IoTDB> select * from root.sg.d1 where time=51853-10-03T00:00:00.000+08:00
+-------------------------------+-------------+
|                           Time|root.sg.d1.s2|
+-------------------------------+-------------+
|+51853-10-03T00:00:00.000+08:00|         8.76|
+-------------------------------+-------------+
Total line number = 1
It costs 0.049s
```

title: [IOTDB-3112] fix login log.
body:
See more details: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3112

title: Fix the issue that sometimes the FragmentInstance may stuck in FLUSHING states
body:
## Description
In some scenario, some FragmentInstance may stuck in FLUSHING state, although the corresponding QueryExecution has already output the final results.

It is because in some query contains `LimitOperator`, the downstream fragment instance will only consume part of TsBlocks produced by its upstream and won't fetch all the TsBlocks. Therefore, the upstream's SinkHandle won't be finished because its TsBlocks are not consumed totally and it also won't receive all the ACK events. So the Fragment Instance which contains this SinkHandle will always stuck in the `FLUSHING` state.

## Solutions
1. Do `SendACK` in SourceHandle once it receives corresponding TsBlocks to avoid the inconsistency that it receives the TsBlock but doesn't send the ACK due to being aborted.
2. When the `ResultHandle` in QueryExecution is finished, transit the QueryExecution to FINISHED

title: [IOTDB-2987] Optimize ConfigNodeGroup startup process
body:
At present, both ConfigNode and DataNode should set all of the ConfigNode's ip:port in order to get connection to any ConfigNode, which is not user-friendly. 

For a better startup mode, ConfigNode and DataNode need only configure the location of an active ConfigNode(target_ConfigNode) to start.

Therefore, I optimize the startup process of ConfigNodeGroup, you can see these docs for more details:

1. [User's manual for deploying Cluster-IoTDB](https://y8dp9fjm8f.feishu.cn/docs/doccnSfXXrSbLu3ETmDWLY5tmwu#)(If you just want to learn about the new startup process)
2. [ConfigNode startup process](https://y8dp9fjm8f.feishu.cn/docs/doccniPRgxESvXlekL0PuSiHolf#)(If you also want to learn  about the ConfigNodeGroup startup process)

title: [IOTDB-3085] move auth to node-commons module
body:
See more details in: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3085.
More details:
1. Move some related parameters from IoTDBConfig to CommonConfig in node-common module.
2. Move `AuthUtils`, `SerializeUtils`, `IOUtils` from server to node-common.
3. Move `security.encrypt` in server to node-common.
4. Move `SystemFileFactory` from server to node-common.
5. Move all class in auth folder of server to node-common except `AuthorityChecker`(which provide check for the engine).
6. Move some auth operation from `AuthorityManager` to ConfigTask in mpp arch.
7. Move some relate-less operation from `AuthorityManager` to `AuthorityChecker`, and move some session related operation from `AuthorityChecker` to `DataNodeTSIServiceImpl`.

title: [IOTDB-3050] Support expression evaluation with time column
Handle the scenarios that there is no data for storage group
body:
## Description
Before this change, there are 2 scenarios which are not handled by query.
1. Query schema if the storage group exists but there is no timeseries inside it.
2. Query the data if the storage group exists but there is no timeseries and data inside it.

After this change, the query in these two scenarios are like:

1. query schema
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18027703/166434122-a5669620-bf36-4229-b290-93ec53c972fb.png)

2. query data
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18027703/166434159-a3eccfbd-4907-4da5-909a-721c4e922503.png)
